result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony M. Terrian was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week, or if not perform 9 hours community service per week.
Maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior authorization.

Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.
AODA w/ follow through.
1 day credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 8:33 am
INCLUDES 16CF630, 15CF956, AND 15CF1088. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty John Bliss. 

MOTION TO REVOKE DEOJ IN 15CF956. 
State moves to revoke DEOJ. 
No objection. 
COURT revokes DEOJ. 
COURT enters judgment of conviction on Ct. 1 (Possess with Intent to Deliver Narcotics). 

PLEA HEARING IN 16CF630. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 
State to file information which will reflect criminal complaint following court today. 
State moves to: 
Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 3 (Possession of THC)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 
PLEA: Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine)>>NO CONTEST. 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

SENTENCING IN 15CF956 AND 16CF630 AND SENTENCING AFTER REV IN 15CF1088. 
VRCW where applicable. 
COURT ORDERS: 
In 16CF630: Ct. 1>>SWH for 3 years probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; AODA and follow through; maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
In 15CF956: Ct. 1>>SWH for 4 years probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; AODA and follow through; maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
In 15CF1088: Ct. 2>>6 months MCJ with huber for work/school/treatment if def qualifies. 
                      : Ct. 3>>90 days MCJ with huber for work/school/treatment if def qualifies. 
COURT ORDERS all sentences to run CONCURRENT to each other. 
COURT finds the def entitled to 76 days jail credit in 15CF1088, 1 day jail credit in 15CF956, and NO days jail credit in 16CF630. 
COURT ORDERS unpaid costs in 15CF1088 converted to civil judgment. 

Adj: 8:53 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on August 16, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on July 14, 2016 at 10:15 am.

DEOJ agreement

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 2:51 pm 
INCLUDES 15CF956 AND 15CF1088. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person with Atty John Bliss.   
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 15CF1088: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                      : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>AMEND TO Misd. BJ pursuant to 946.49(1)(a). 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CF956: Ct. 1 (Possess with intent to deliver narcotics)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CF1088: Amended Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 
                      : Ct. 3>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, def guilty of Cts. 2 & 3 in 15CF1088, and defers entry of judgment in 15CF956. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 15CF956: Ct 1>>DEOJ for 2 years with conditions as outlined in written agreement. 
In 15CF1088: Cts. 2 & 3>>SWH for 1 year probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2; AODA; no contact with A.L; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 

COURT finds the def is entitled to 1 day jail credit if revoked in both files. 

Review Hearing for DEOJ set for February 23, 2018 at 10:45 am in Br. 3 Courtroom in 15CF956.
